# Stellaris 4.2 Game Mechanics

<!-- Auto-generated from patch notes. Do not edit manually. -->

### **Origins & Civics**

*   **Augmentation Bazaars:** Empires with this civic select cybernetic traits during empire creation. *(Allows for early-game biological specialization before full cybernetic ascension.)*
*   **Clone Army:** 
    *   The Clone Soldier trait carries a 25% increase to food and mineral pop upkeep. *(Requires a more robust basic resource economy to sustain the starting population.)*
    *   Ascended Clones have a 30% food/mineral upkeep penalty, while Fertile Clones have a 10% penalty. *(Ascension significantly increases the cost of maintaining the elite soldier class.)*
    *   Clone Vats provide a maximum of 20 pop assembly and require food upkeep. *(Limits the explosive growth speed of clone-based empires compared to other assembly types.)*
*   **Knights of the Toxic God:**
    *   Knight jobs provide quest progress and produce 2 Unity and 2 of each research type. *(Knights serve as a hybrid source of progress rather than pure research specialists.)*
    *   The Luminous Blades modifier grants +1 Admiral Level; Knights retain their standard alloy upkeep. *(Shifts the bonus toward military leadership quality rather than economic efficiency.)*
    *   Sparing the Toxic Entity unlocks the ability to terraform Toxic World candidates. *(Provides a massive expansion opportunity in the late game for empires that choose mercy.)*
    *   The Dimensional Manipulation Device requires high resource upkeep. *(Demands a late-game economic surplus to maintain its benefits.)*
*   **Life Seeded:** The homeworld contains improved rare resource features. *(Guarantees early access to strategic resources for advanced building upgrades.)*
*   **Overtuned:**
    *   Overt
